messages.subject: Kodogu for sale.
messages.msgSnippet: Hi all. Well I am moving a few things. Some , well quite a few you will notice have already sold but I thought I would add what is reaming here to see if there
messages.messageBody:
Hi all. Well I am moving a few things. Some , well quite a few you will
notice have already sold but I thought I would add what is reaming here
to see if there is any interest.

http://www.nihonto-bijutsubu.com/personal/collection/sale.html

Please feel free to contact me via email if you have any interest or
questions.

Cheers

Rich Turner

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Sale 50% Off
messages.msgSnippet: ... Ron, I ve had a large display of books for sale at the last 4 or 5 Chicago shows - 3 or 4 tables large - but I only live about 15 miles away. This year s
messages.messageBody:
On Fri, Jan 22, 2010 at 7:44 PM, Ron Hartmann <swords@...> wrote:

>
>
> Hi Craig -
>
> Yes, I would say the good old economy has put a lot of us on hold for
> awhile. Both of those books are super and I'm sure any buyers will be
> thrilled to get them at a great price. Unfortunately, I bought my copies as
> they became available, but hey, I'm happy. I still remember your display of
> books at one of the shows. I couldn't imagine going through all that work of
> transporting all that "weight." Made me think of the old days when my wife
> and I used to bring all those books and stuff to shows for the JSS/US. Makes
> my back hurt just thinking of it!
>
> Hope sales pick up, for books and for our for sale swords and fittings!
>
> Ron
> STL
> -
>

Ron,

I've had a large display of books for sale at the last 4 or 5 Chicago shows
- 3 or 4 tables large - but I only live about 15 miles away. This year's
might be a table less, since I sold my truck recently, but I do have help
with the heavy lifting.

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Bridge of Dreams, LLC
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com
Member, IOBA, Independent Online Booksellers Association
Member, MWABA, Midwest Antiquarian Booksellers Association


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Sale 50% Off
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Craig - Yes, I would say the good old economy has put a lot of us on hold for awhile. Both of those books are super and I m sure any buyers will be thrilled
messages.messageBody:
Hi Craig -

Yes, I would say the good old economy has put a lot of us on hold for awhile. Both of those books are super and I'm sure any buyers will be thrilled to get them at a great price. Unfortunately, I bought my copies as they became available, but hey, I'm happy. I still remember your display of books at one of the shows. I couldn't imagine going through all that work of transporting all that "weight." Made me think of the old days when my wife and I used to bring all those books and stuff to shows for the JSS/US. Makes my back hurt just thinking of it!

Hope sales pick up, for books and for our for sale swords and fittings!

Ron
STL
----- Original Message -----
From: Craig Harris
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 22, 2010 6:55 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Sale 50% Off



On Fri, Jan 22, 2010 at 5:27 PM, Ron Hartmann <swords@...> wrote:

>
>
> Holy cow...guess I shouldn't bother bringing my Goto copy to Tampa to
> sell...you're giving these away!
>
> Ron
> STL
>
Ron,

I'm not going to Tampa, haven't been in a number of years, so I won't be
there to compete with your copy in person.

If you're driving and have room, throw it in. I never had the time to drive,
so the economics of being a bookseller anywhere except the Chicago show
never worked for me.

As far as the pricing, it's all supply and demand, and I have more supply
than I need, and haven't found anyone willing to take books for food,
tuition, etc.

See you in Chicago!

Regards,

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Bridge of Dreams, LLC
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com
Member, IOBA, Independent Online Booksellers Association
Member, MWABA, Midwest Antiquarian Booksellers Association

From: Craig Harris
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, January 22, 2010 5:09 PM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Book Sale 50% Off



On Fri, Jan 22, 2010 at 4:54 PM, Les Dorfman <ldorfman@...> wrote:

>
>
> ...and is there a hidden meaning in this ?
>
> Les
>
>
>
Nothing up my sleeve, just keeping the trickle of cash flowing. You know how
us poor booksellers are, scraping by.

Hey, I'm overstocked on Fukushi's Goto book, only a couple copies of his
Machibori book left. At $575 plus shipping for the pair, even
guys that hate Goto are getting interested.

Going to Florida?

Craig

messages.subject: Book Sale 50% Off
messages.msgSnippet: Please pardon the commercial posting, duplicate posting, and if you have seen this on the Nihonto Message Board already. I started a 50% off sale on all books
messages.messageBody:
Please pardon the commercial posting, duplicate posting, and if you have
seen this on the Nihonto Message Board already.

I started a 50% off sale on all books on my website except consignment books
(those with CONSIGNED in the description) on the NMB a few days ago, and
wanted to extend it to all on all the lists.
The sale will continue for at least a few more days, and I will announce the
end of the sale with about 24 hours notice.

I will reduce the prices on consigned books as much as I can but most of
them have nominal markups.

Shipping at cost.

All other terms per my website. All orders are processed by me and totals
including shipping confirmed before your credit card (or PayPal) is charged
- nothing is automatic about the back end of my website.

Thanks for looking,

Craig

--
Craig Harris
Bridge of Dreams, LLC
Books from and about Asia
www.bridgeofdreams.com
Member, IOBA, Independent Online Booksellers Association
Member, MWABA, Midwest Antiquarian Booksellers Association
